title: How to Make Orange Citrus Steak Sauce

steps.headline: Cook a steak or two in a cast iron skillet.
Put the steaks on a plate (you will eat them soon).
Leave the heat from the stove on with the empty skillet.
Allow it to sit for about three minutes.
steps.description: You want the skillet to be dry. If necessary, drain the steak juices and allow the skillet to become dry.

steps.headline: Pour a little water on the hot pan.
steps.description: It will begin to bead up and steam

steps.headline: Scrape the pan with a wooden spoon, creating a brownish gravy.
steps.description: This is what cleans the pan.

steps.headline: Add a little orange juice which should do the same thing.
Roll it around in the pan a little to mix it.
Pour the sauce into a saucer or bowl.
